html: By addressing Ahaz as “the house of David,” Isaiah reminds Ahaz verbally, not just symbolically, of his duty toward his people under the terms of the Davidic Covenant. At the same time, he rebukes Ahaz for his people’s suffering under his oppressive rule. In addition, Isaiah alters the covenant formula “your God” (v 11) to “my God,” inferring that by rejecting Jehovah’s word Ahaz has rejected his God, breaking the terms of the Davidic Covenant. Meanwhile, the presence of Isaiah’s son Shear-Jashub (“A Remnant Shall Return”) symbolically predicts the consequences of Ahaz’ recalcitrance.
